title: Add RFC822 to time package, to support RSS date-times
body:
by **peterbourgon**: 
"All date-times in RSS conform to the Date and Time Specification of RFC 
822."
http://cyber.law.harvard.edu/rss/rss.html

Luckily, date-time in RFC 822 is almost identical to RFC 1123, which is 
supported. However, 822 allows time zones to be specified as "explicit offset 
from UT", eg. "-0500". In theory it also allows the military
"1ALPHA" method 
of time zone specification, though I haven't seen this in the wild.
http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc822.html

Could you please either add RFC822 support to the time pkg, or allow an 
expanded range of time zone formats when using time.Parse with RFC1123? 
Thank you!
